TextView.android:text: Before you use this app, please ensure that internet is enabled. Depending if you are pit scouting or objective scouting, you will use either the objective or pit scouting parts of this app.

For objective scouting, fill out each field, then submit. The top category corresponds to general match information, followed by the sandstorm category - this category pertains exclusively to sandstorm information (so any hatch or cargo scored does not get counted below).

The next two sections (hatch and cargo) pertain specifically to hatches and cargo scored or dropped by the robot during the 135-second period following sandstorm. Whenever hatches or cargo are scored or dropped, select the appropriate button to mark this. Below this is the climbing category - just mark the HAB level to which the robot climbs and helps/is helped by another robot when climbing.
This works the same way while pit scouting, just make sure to ask the appropriate questions for each field to the team being pit scouted.

When both objective and subjective scouting, you will see reset and submit buttons. The reset button works the same way in both objective and pit scouting - tap it once to reset, and the button will turn into a confirmation button. Tap it again to reset, or tap any other field to abort the operation.

The submit button is also the same for objective and pit scouting. When done with all fields, tap it to submit. If you have not filled out all fields, the app will tell you to do so, making the text of the fields you did not submit red, and will not submit. If you have, the app will both log your data to an external file (saving it) and send it to the spreadsheet used for analytics. You should see messages saying that the send and save operations were successful; however, you may get saving or sending errors (in which case the app will notify you directly after submitting). If this happens, see me (Harsh) and I will attempt to troubleshoot.
